content.description:
Source 1St. Auta Altarpiece, Painting by an Unknown Portuguese Artist Completed in Lisbon, Portugal Circa 1520

The painting shows a wedding ceremony between a light-skinned groom and a light-skinned bride.

The groom and bride are both crowned and wearing elaborate, colorful clothing.

A bishop in religious regalia stands before the bride and groom to conduct the ceremony.

The groom and bride are flanked by richly dressed attendants.

In the upper right background, a group of dark-skinned musicians in colorful uniforms play various musical instruments.

Source 2Detail from St. Auta Altarpiece

The detail is a close-up view of the musicians in the upper right corner of the St. Auta Altarpiece painting.

Five musicians wear red and green uniforms with gold hats.Â 

The musicians are playing various types of horns.
Bridgeman Images
content.question: Which of the following statements best explains why Africans were included in this painting?

choices.label: Portugal was not involved with the slave trade and instead relied on the labor of skilled African artisans in Lisbon.
Africans from a variety of backgrounds lived and worked in Mediterranean port cities.
Religion was the primary reason for increased connections between Africa and Europe.
Europeans viewed Africans as subordinate and refused to interact with Africans as equals.

content.answer: Africans from a variety of backgrounds lived and worked in Mediterranean port cities.
